org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports

Class NiHeaderInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.NiHeaderInfo

  • public class NiHeaderInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    the header layout of a NiReport. The headers of a report are a forest of trees. The trees are as follows:
    1. each of the columns, regardless of whether it is a hierarchy. Their names equal the name of the respective column
    2. In case the report has a GroupingCriteria different from GroupingCriteria.GROUPING_TOTALS_ONLY, there is a root for time-split measures. Its name is NiReportsEngine.FUNDING_COLUMN_NAME
    3. a tree holding the totals, in case any of the columns or measures present in the report generate totals. Please see VSplitStrategy.getTotalSubcolumnName()

    In order to simplify the code handling the headers of a report, an artificial root node named NiReportsEngine.ROOT_COLUMN_NAME is created by NiReports Core: the natural headers are pushed as being its children. Thus, code which outputs headers in an user-visible way should skip the root node. Please see NiReportsFormatter.buildHeaders() for an example

    • Field Detail

      • rootColumn

        public final GroupColumn rootColumn
        the artificial root

      • leafColumns

        public final java.util.List<CellColumn> leafColumns
        the leaves of the header. Since each Column holds a link to its parent column (in Column.getParent()), it is possible to do a full reconstruction of the tree by following up-pointers from leaves

      • nrHierarchies

        public final int nrHierarchies
        the number of hierarchies in the structure of the headers

      • rasterizedHeaders

        public final java.util.List<java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,Column>> rasterizedHeaders
        the headers rasterized (e.g rendered as a bidimensional matrix). Since:
        • a given column's width equals the sum of the widths of its children. A leaf column's width is always 1
        • a column's height (also called depth) is dynamically calculated by NiReports Core based on a number of heuristics which should not be reimplemented or reverse engineered
        , an individual headers' row is rasterized as a SortedMap rasterizedHeaders[i] = columns which start on row i of the header, SortedMap

    • Constructor Detail

      • NiHeaderInfo

        public NiHeaderInfo(NiReportsEngine engine,
                    GroupColumn rootColumn,
                    int nrHierarchies)
        given as input the artificial root column, calculates the columns' widths and heights (e.g. rasterizes the header) and constructs an instance of NiHeaderInfo
        HeaderCalculator is the rasterization implementation. This could, in principle, be made pluggable, but it is not needed ATM
        Parameters:

        nrHierarchies -
